]]> By: Sharing and the OCWC Conference at OCW Blog http://sharing-nicely.net/2008/08/isummit-2008-open-education-feedback/#comment-28 Fri, 29 Aug 2008 18:24:18 +0000 http://bokaap.net/bits-and-pieces/isummit-2008-open-education-feedback/#comment-28 [...] Great post today from OCWC board member Phillip Schmidt on the iSummit event he attended — what went well, what might have went better. As a communications guy getting ready for our own conference in September, this graf, on how best to share the conference with the larger community, was particularly thought-provoking: The natural response to this would be: “place more emphasis on documentation and share audio/video/text online”. However, having facilitated the documentation efforts at the iSummit 2007 I know how hard it is to collect all the images and notes from participants, and how much (tedious) editing is required to bring it together into a useful resource. Yet, I am not sure how many people actually go back to the notes beyond trying to find email addresses of people they met, or links to projects that were mentioned. In 2007, Mark and I knew we were going to write an article about the event, so having very detailed notes was more important than this year. [...]
